metadata.title: YouTube End Screen Template 2025: Sizes, Timing & Best Practices
metadata.description: Create effective YouTube end screens. Templates, dimensions, timing, and strategies to keep viewers watching.

hero.headline: YouTube End Screen Templates & Best Practices
hero.subheadline: Keep viewers on your channel with effective end screens that drive subscriptions and views.

sections.content: End screens appear in the last 5-20 seconds of your video. They can include video links, subscribe buttons, channel links, and external links (if eligible). Effective end screens keep viewers watching more of your content and convert them to subscribers.

content.title: Video Elements
content.description: Link to specific videos or let YouTube suggest best match. Up to 4 elements total.

content.title: Subscribe Button
content.description: Prominent subscribe prompt. Include in every end screen.

content.title: External Link
content.description: Link to approved external sites. Requires YPP membership.

sections.title: End Screen Specifications
content: Safe zone: Keep clear space for elements

sections.title: End Screen Best Practices
content: Design video outro with element placement in mind
Include subscribe button on every video
Use 'best for viewer' video option strategically
Create visual hierarchy directing to elements
Don't stack elements on top of each other
Verbally call out what to click

faq.question: How long should end screens be?
faq.answer: 10-20 seconds is ideal. Long enough for viewers to click, short enough not to tank retention. 5 seconds minimum is too short.

faq.question: Should I use 'best for viewer' or specific videos?
faq.answer: Mix both. 'Best for viewer' lets YouTube optimize. Specific videos work for series or related content. Test what works.

faq.question: Do end screens hurt retention?
faq.answer: Yes, slightly. Viewers who leave during end screen count against average view duration. But the trade-off for continued viewing is worth it.

faq.question: Can I add end screens after uploading?
faq.answer: Yes. Add or edit end screens anytime in YouTube Studio. You can also apply end screen templates across multiple videos.
